intro: Coryphantha calochlora, commonly known as the bright yellow coryphantha, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems and vibrant yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant's structure and growth habits make it a notable species in desert ecosystems.
